Former Oasis frontman Liam Gallagher has been labelled a ‘voice of reason’ after wading into the Brexit debate . 
The singer, who is heading to Tyneside to perform at the Metro Radio Arena in November , was quizzed on his views on the controversial 2016 referendum and Britain’s subsequent decision to leave the EU. 
And his response has become an online hit among the 48% of Brits who voted remain. 
He also labelled US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un ‘d***s’. Former Oasis frontman Liam Gallagher (Image: PA) 
The 45-year-old, who is known for his outspoken comments, said in an interview with NME: “I love Europe. 
“I guess the borders have got to be tightened but all that stuff about going ‘this is my country’, I don’t get that. 
“We all live under one sky. I certainly don’t sit there and go ‘this is my f England, stay out’, but I think we should definitely keep an eye on who’s coming in and out of the country. Read More 
“That just makes common sense because you don’t want loony ’ coming in. But good people should be allowed to move and groove wherever they want.” 
That saw him widely praised for his insightful and ‘reasonable’ response. 
Julie Owen Moylan said: “Twitter the most sensible thing I’ve read today is Liam Gallagher . That’s where we are on Brexit.” An anti-Brexit protester waves an EU flag outside the Houses of Parliament (Image: PA) 
Ben Disley added: “Liam Gallagher actually making more sense than the whole of the cabinet on Brexit.” 
Whilst Robert Nobes said: “Literally a more coherent argument than anything Theresa May has put together in the last 12 months.”
